context: Vincent van Gogh produced over 30 self-portraits between 1886 and 1889. A primary motivation for this intensive self-study was his severe financial struggles. Although this financial predicament limited his immediate artistic options, it indirectly spurred discussions on the psychological impact of self-representation in modern art circles. This practice allowed him to continue honing his skills as a portraitist without the associated costs.
